column3: `test/coins_tests.cpp:74:7: error: cannot derive from ‘final’ base ‘CCoinsViewCache’ in derived type ‘{anonymous}::CCoinsViewCacheTest’\n class CCoinsViewCacheTest : public CCoinsViewCache`

> test/coins_tests.cpp:74:7: error: cannot derive from ‘final’ base ‘CCoinsViewCache’ in derived type ‘{anonymous}::CCoinsViewCacheTest’ class CCoinsViewCacheTest : public CCoinsViewCache\n\nYou can fix that by renaming the existing `CCoinsViewCache` to a non-`final` `CCoinsViewCacheBase`, and have `CCoinsViewCache` become a `final` subclass of that with no implementation except a constructor. T

@theuni Two more devirtualization opportunities (from closed PR #10847):\n* Declaring `CCoinsViewErrorCatcher` final enables devirtualization of two calls\n* Declaring `CReserveKey` final enables devirtualization of one call
@practicalswift I'll pull in the other two, but I think we should drop the CCoinsViewCache one. The inheritance there is hard enough to follow already.
